Today, Dan and Jordan discuss the tumultuous past few days in the world of Alex Jones. They deal with the depositon drama, and then break down the episode Alex did instead of listening to his doctor and staying home.

==Detailed Show Notes==

Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/3/24/episode-662-march-22-2022 Episode #662: March 22: 2022]</ref>:

*Alex tried [https://civilinquiry.jud.ct.gov/DocumentInquiry/DocumentInquiry.aspx?DocumentNo=22444289 some dicey doctors notes] to get out of having to go to a deposition
*The court [https://civilinquiry.jud.ct.gov/DocumentInquiry/DocumentInquiry.aspx?DocumentNo=22444550 did not accept Alex's excuse], and then Alex [https://civilinquiry.jud.ct.gov/DocumentInquiry/DocumentInquiry.aspx?DocumentNo=22447435 did not show up] for his deposition
*Alex's doctor, [https://www.amyoffuttmd.com/faq/ Dr. Offutt], does not seem like a doctor you'd go to for an emergency issue
*Yale Law School [https://avalon.law.yale.edu/subject_menus/imt.asp archive of transcripts] from Nuremberg Trials
